page.title: 15Little Fell Farm (M)
page.content:
Visit to Little Fell Farm,Quernmore.
On Friday, 21st June, six of us went to visit Little Fell Farm, Quernmore. The farmer's name is Robert Whittaker and he farms 120 acres. He owns 80 acres and rents 40. The farm is a family concern. There are 18 fields,9 are meadows, the other nine are managed grass. It is a mixed farm, with mainly dairy and some beef cattle. There are 8 bulls which are kept in a barn. The milking parlour smelled. Eight cows are milked at once. They give 190000 litres a year. On the farm there are 3 tractors, a mower, a rowing up machine which puts the cut grass into straight rows, a bailer and a spreader. The farmer also sells woodburning stoves.
